title: Invoice vs. Estimate: What's the difference?
meta: Understand the difference between an invoice and an estimate. When to send each and how to transition from quote to payment.
summary: Confused about when to send an estimate versus an invoice? This guide breaks down the timing and purpose of each document.
h1: Invoice vs. Estimate: Timing and Purpose.

sections.content: An estimate is sent before the work begins. It outlines the projected costs and scope for client approval.
An invoice is a request for payment sent after the work (or a milestone) is completed.

faq.q: Can an estimate be a contract?
faq.a: Yes, if signed by both parties, an estimate can serve as a binding agreement.
